edge_1: In 1999, Carey released her last album with Columbia Records, Rainbow, which included some of the material created for All That Glitters.
edge_2: Virgin Records allowed Carey to continue working on All That Glitters, with the film's concept being about a club dancer who becomes a successful singer and its soundtrack following a modernized version of the 1980s sound.
edge_3: Following Carey's departure from Columbia Records in 2001, she signed a US$100 million record deal with Virgin Records (EMI Records), which gave her full conceptual and creative control over the project.
